name: Jinyang Liu 0003
content: Jinyang's Homepage Jinyang Liu Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science University of Houston Email: jliu 217 at central dot uh dot edu Google Scholar CV Biography Jinyang Liu is an assistant professor at the Department of Computer Science of the University of Houston. He received a PhD degree in Computer Science at the University of California, Riverside in June 2024. Prior to that, He received Master's degree in Data Science from Peking University in 2019 and received B.S. degree in Mathematics and Applied Mathematics from Peking University in 2016. He has also been worked as a long-term research intern at the Argonne National Laboratory (ANL). Jinyang's major research field is High-Performance Computing, focusing on the topics of error-bounded lossy compression for scientific data. He also has research interests and experiences broadly in the areas of Parallel Computing, Data management/reduction, and Artificial Intelligence. He has presented publications in various highly prestigious conferences and journals such as SIGMOD, VLDB, SC, ICDE, ICS, HPDC, IEEE IPDPS, etc. He has received the Dissertation Year Fellowship (DYP) award from UCR and Best Paper Nominations from ICS 23 and HPDC 25. He has developed several popular different scientific data error-bounded lossy compressors, such as SZ3, QoZ, and cuSZ. Jinyang is looking for several Ph. D. students to join his lab in Spring 2026 or later. His full CV is at: My CV. Check here for more information about opening PhD positions in his lab. Research Interests High Performance Computing Scientific Data Management Deep learning for High Performance Computing and Data Reduction AI for Science Education Ph. D. in Computer Science, University of California, Riverside, 2019 - 2024. M. S. in Data Science, Peking University, 2016 - 2019. B. S. in Mathematics and Applied Mathematics, Peking University, 2011 - 2016. Awards Best Paper Nomination in the 34th ACM International Symposium on High-Performance Parallel and Distributed Computing (HPDC '25), 2025 Best Paper Nomination in International Conference on Supercomputing 2023 (ICS '23), 2023 Dissertation Year Program Fellowship, University of California, Riverside, 2023 Outstanding Graduate Student, Peking University, 2019 Outstanding Research Award, Peking University, 2018 Students Ziwei Qiu (PhD @ UH CS, 2025.01 - ) Nicholas Anderson (PhD @ UH CS, 2025.08 - ) Alumni Jinwen Pan (Thesis advisee, MS @ TUM CS, 2024.12 - 2025.07) Melis Irmak (Thesis advisee, MS @ UH CS, 2024.09 - 2025.05) Latest News Our paper: "Boosting Scientific Error-Bounded Lossy Compression through Optimized Synergistic Lossy-Lossless Orchestration" was accepted by SC 25. Congratulations to Shixun and Jinwen! 06/2025: Our NSF CSSI project "SGCC: An Efficient GPU-oriented Data Reduction Cyberinfrastructure for Scientific Data Analysis" was awarded (total amount: $600K, my role: lead PI, my share: $180K). 04/2025: Our HPDC '25 paper was nominated for the Best Paper Award. 04/2025: My first-author paper QPET: A Versatile and Portable Quantity-of-Interest-Preservation Framework for Error-Bounded Lossy Compression was accepted by VLDB '25. 04/2025: One paper was accepted by CSUR. 04/2025: One paper was accepted by HPDC '25. 04/2025: One paper was accepted by ICS '25. 12/2024: One paper was accepted by IPDPS '25. 11/2024: One paper was accepted by PPoPP '25. 10/2024: One paper was accepted by SIGMOD '25. 08/2024: My employment as an assistant professor of the department of Computer Science at the University of Houston started. 07/2024: One paper was accepted by CLUSTER '24. 06/2024: My first-author paper CUSZ-i: High-Ratio Scientific Lossy Compression on GPUs with Optimized Multi-Level Interpolation and another 1 paper were accepted by SC '24. 04/2024: One paper was accepted by ICS '24. 03/2024: I will join the department of Computer Science at the University of Houston on Fall 2024. 01/2024: Two papers were accepted by IPDPS '24. 11/2023: One paper was accepted by ICDE '24. 11/2023: My first-author paper High-performance Effective Scientific Error-bounded Lossy Compression with Auto-tuned Multi-component Interpolation was accepted by SIGMOD '24. 10/2023: My first-author paper Scientific Error-bounded Lossy Compression with Super-resolution Neural Networks and two other papers were accepted by BigData '23. 09/2023: One paper was accepted by TPDS. 08/2023: One poster was accepted by Cluster '23. 07/2023: One paper was accepted by Cluster '23. 06/2023: Attended the ICS '23 conference. Made a presentation of my paper FAZ: A flexible auto-tuned modular error-bounded compression framework for scientific data. 05/2023: My accepted ICS '23 paper FAZ: A flexible auto-tuned modular error-bounded compression framework for scientific data was nominated for the Best Paper Award. Teaching 2025 Fall: COSC 6397: Information Theory and Data Compression (@UH-CS). 2025 Spring: COSC 2306: Data Programming (@UH-CS). 2024 Fall: COSC 2306: Data Programming (@UH-CS). Services Program Committee: ICS 2025, Cluster 2025, CCGrid 2025, ICDCS 2025, GPGPU 2025, IWBDR 2023, DRBSD-10/11. Reviewer: HiPC 2024, IPDPS 2024, CCGrid 2024, ICS 2023, DCC 2023, HDIS 2022, IWBDR 2022/2023, ICMLA 2021, TPDS, THPC, TOMM.
